text: « Painful swelling * Pathologic fracture * Xeray: osteolytic lesions with or without marginal sclerosis * Typicaly, solitary lesions Langerhans cell * Peakincidence: * Most commonly in the skull « May manifest with rash and recurrent histiocytosis 2] 5-10years < otitis media with mastoid swelling « Lesions near the sphenoid, orbital, ethmoid, or temporal bones require treatment with vinblastine and prednisone.
